This willow tray is handcrafted from natural materials. It features sturdy construction, an attractive light brown stain, braided rim and ear handles for easy carrying. It is the perfect size for many applications. Create gift baskets for family and friends. Or use around the house to display your baked goods, silverware, napkins, magazines or crafts. Basket measures 16-inches by 12-inches across inside top diamter and 4-inches deep. Imported.
Create a chic catchall on any table or shelf in your home with the Wald Import 22 in. Round Honey Willow Basket . This round basket features a classic woven design and large handles on the ends.

descriptions.value: The Auray DUSM-1 Universal Shockmount features a four-point suspension to accommodate shotgun and other cylindrical microphones measuring 0.74 - 0.98 (19-25mm) in diameter. The shockmount is easily angled with its rubberized adjustment knob. There is a built-in shoe for camera mounting, and a 3/8-16 thread connection at the base mounts the shockmount to boompoles and universal hand-grips.

The Auray DUSM-1 Universal Shockmount features a four-point suspension to accommodate shotgun and other cylindrical microphones measuring 0.74-0.98 (19-25mm) in diameter. The shockmount is easily angled with its rubberized adjustment knob. There is a built-in shoe for camera mounting, and a 3/8-16 thread connection at the base mounts the shockmount to boompoles and universal hand-grips.

The Auray DUSM-1 Universal Shockmount features a four-point suspension to accommodate shotgun and other cylindrical microphones measuring 0.74-0.98" (19-25mm) in diameter. The shockmount is easily angled with its rubberized adjustment knob. There is a built-in shoe for camera mounting, and a 3/8"-16 thread connection at the base mounts the shockmount to boompoles and universal handgrips.

reviews.text: Bands are strong but pretty tight. Not much play. Might not fit larger mics.
reviews.title: Strong

reviews.text: I consistently use a Sennheiser MKH 416-P48U3 shotgun mic with this shockmount and it does a very good job at isolating vibration to the mic. It is a solid shockmount for the price. The reason I'm only giving it four stars instead of five is because you have to be really careful of the tiny screw that attaches the cold shoe mount to the rest of the unit (at the very bottom of unit). After multiple uses I've had that tiny screw loosen and fall out which renders the shockmount completely useless if you lose that tiny screw.
reviews.title: Good Shockmount for the Price

reviews.text: I ordered this with some trepidation as others had remarked that it is not too robust. For my purposes--use in my office for video conferencing, it is just fine, and I appreciate its compact size. I have mounted it to a small piece of (fairly heavy) wood with a bolt, and it is very stable and easy to adjust. The isolation, so far, is excellent. I think it is a bit light for life on the road, on camera or a boom pole, but I'd use it in a pinch and just exercise some care.
reviews.title: Good for desktop applications.

reviews.text: I bought this mount for my Sennheiser shotgun..... works very well, and introduces no mount noise to on camera use. But unable to find a right angle XLR connector, I had one made. So shooting stills with mic mounted no longer generates a mic connector poke in the face. This has nothing to do with the mount, though. It has been as sturdy as needed, and iStock Online was fast shipper. Good product
reviews.title: Great Mic Mount for Sennheiser shotgun

reviews.text: If you have a shotgun mic that could use a shockmount at this size, (get your dimensions first), I'd say this is a winner. I prefer shockmounts that use more than two sets of elastic strung perpendicular to one another to hold the mic tight. Works well with a Synco shotgun mic that my wife uses for voice over. Bonus is the base of the mount has a baseplate for mounting on cameras.
reviews.title: Solidly made shock mount.

reviews.text: Great for a shotgun mic and can mount using the cold shoe or screw onto a pole or hand held grip.

reviews.text: This mount is made of cheap plastic and breaks easily. One of the screws holding the mount together literally cracked the plastic within an hour of receiving my product. Luckily, Amazon allowed me to return it and the process was pretty easy. In he brief time I used this product, I found this it did very little to prevent handling noise. My shotgun mic may have been too large, but I did not find it to be effective. Given the price and the cheap construction, I do not rate it highly or recommend it.
reviews.title: Cheap construction

reviews.text: easy to set up and super quite operation.

reviews.text: If the circumference on your mic is close to the maximum for this mount, removing the mic usually detaches the shock mounts from the surrounding rig. Clamp is quality for a budget item. Comes with a dual cold-shoe/threaded mount. Very good, if a little too much on the budget end of the spectrum.
reviews.title: Check equipment for fitment

reviews.text: Circle is a little tight for my mic. But otherwise solid.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.text: I have a rode ntg1 microphone and a WS6 wind sock for it. When paired with a Canon xa-11 and the Auray universal shock mount, the audio is clean and crisp. The shock mount is essential for some video equipment, because the included microphone mounts with some models may not be tall enough to prevent an optional wind sock or muff to be seen in the field of view of the recording equipment. That was the problem I had with the Canon xa-11 microphone mount included with the camcorder. But the Auray universal shock mount was the perfect solution and pairs with the rode line of microphones beautifully. It also helps reduce unwanted noise from bumps or any vigorous activity while filming. Great product that's simple but useful in many film applications.
reviews.title: Must have for RODE microphones

reviews.text: This little shockmount is amazing. Half the price of my previous shockmount but twice as good. It’s compact, durable, it tightens up on the swivel really well and it has a cold shoe that allows you to also attach It to a camera, which I’ve done a few times and it’s great. My favorite feature, though, has to be how the mic slips in and out but still grips the mic tightly when in use. As pro voice over and audio tech, I switch out mics frequently and this works as well as it did when I got it a year ago. It’s the only shotgun shockmount I recommend to my students and clients. I love it.
reviews.title: Best Value - No Question
